result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan F Saavedra was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Schedule IV Drugs, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(i).
  • Manufacture/Deliver Schedule IV Drugs, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(i).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Imposed and Stayed.  Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 6 years bifurcated sentence.
Imposed and Stayed.  Conditions, if revoked, are as outlined in probation conditions.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law.  Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.  Defendant is not to have any narcotic drugs of any kind, even with a prescription.

Defendant must attend 5 self-help meetings per week and provide signed proof of attendance.  Defendant is to sign medical release to allow agent access to medical and prescription records.  Agent is to approve all prescriptions.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

timeConds.notes: Eligible for ZCI program.  Upon successful completion of program, balance is stayed.

records.addlTxt: Per RASO - mandatory jail time has been served
For funeral furlough on 1/9/15 from 9:00 am until 2:00 pm
Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.
Reading waived.
ATN requested from Records Bureau
Sentencing hearing on November 14, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Ryan F Saavedra in court with attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty.  Jennifer C. Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Rose Coulthart.
Matter was set for PLEAS on 14CF796 and SEH on 13CF562 and 13CF1363.
Court will require an updated PSI including 14CF796.
Plea:
14CF796 - Cts. 1,5,7,8 - G.
BTC: 
14CF796:  Cts. 1,5,7,8 - GUILTY.  Cts. 2,3,4,6,9,10 - DRI.  Updated PSI ordered.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 14, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Defendant must attend one self-help meeting every day and provide proof of attendance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Ryan F Saavedra in court with attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty.  Defendant Ryan F Saavedra in custody.  Jennifer C. Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Nancy Szeklinski.
Defense req bond  mod.
State agrees.
BTC:  Bond is converted to sig bond.  No alcohol.  1 self-help meeting daily.  Must provide proof of attendance. All other conditions remain.
ATTY Cafferty files bond review motion

Defendant Ryan F Saavedra in court with attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty.  Defendant Ryan F Saavedra in custody.  Jennifer C. Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Rose Coulthart.
Matter was set for SEH, but there is a new case.  Parties request adjournment.
BTC:  Adjourn.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 23, 2014 at 10:30 am.
